Events.text: Judas Maccabeus, son of Mattathias of the Hasmonean family, restores the Temple in Jerusalem. This event is commemorated each year by the festival of Hanukkah.
Events.html: Judas Maccabeus, son of Mattathias of the Hasmonean family, restores the Temple in Jerusalem. This event is commemorated each year by the festival of Hanukkah.

Events.text: Pope Anterus succeeds Pontian as the nineteenth pope. During the persecutions of emperor Maximinus Thrax he is martyred.
Events.html: Pope Anterus succeeds Pontian as the nineteenth pope. During the persecutions of emperor Maximinus Thrax he is martyred.

Events.text: Lý Công Uẩn is enthroned as emperor of Đại Cồ Việt, founding the Lý dynasty.
Events.html: Lý Công Uẩn is enthroned as emperor of Đại Cồ Việt, founding the Lý dynasty.

Events.text: Timur of Samarkand captures and sacks the Georgian capital of Tbilisi, taking King Bagrat V of Georgia captive.
Events.html: Timur of Samarkand captures and sacks the Georgian capital of Tbilisi, taking King Bagrat V of Georgia captive.

Events.text: Plymouth Colony settlers sign the Mayflower Compact (November 11, O.S.)
Events.html: Plymouth Colony settlers sign the Mayflower Compact (November 11, O.S.)

links.title: Old Style and New Style dates

Events.text: The Danish astronomer Ole Rømer presents the first quantitative measurements of the speed of light.
Events.html: The Danish astronomer Ole Rømer presents the first quantitative measurements of the speed of light.

links.title: Rømer's determination of the speed of light

Events.text: In Paris, Jean-François Pilâtre de Rozier and François Laurent d'Arlandes, make the first untethered hot air balloon flight.
Events.html: In Paris, Jean-François Pilâtre de Rozier and François Laurent d'Arlandes, make the first untethered hot air balloon flight.

Events.text: North Carolina ratifies the United States Constitution and is admitted as the 12th U.S. state.
Events.html: North Carolina ratifies the United States Constitution and is admitted as the 12th U.S. state.

Events.text: Wabash College is founded in Crawfordsville, Indiana.
Events.html: Wabash College is founded in Crawfordsville, Indiana.

Events.text: American Civil War: Confederate President Jefferson Davis appoints Judah Benjamin Secretary of War.
Events.html: American Civil War: Confederate President Jefferson Davis appoints Judah Benjamin Secretary of War.

Events.text: Thomas Edison announces his invention of the phonograph, a machine that can record and play sound.
Events.html: Thomas Edison announces his invention of the phonograph, a machine that can record and play sound.

Events.text: Port Arthur, China falls to the Japanese, a decisive victory of the First Sino-Japanese War; Japanese troops are accused of massacring the remaining inhabitants.
Events.html: Port Arthur, China falls to the Japanese, a decisive victory of the First Sino-Japanese War; Japanese troops are accused of massacring the remaining inhabitants.

Events.text: The Philadelphia Football Athletics defeated the Kanaweola Athletic Club of Elmira, New York, 39–0, in the first ever professional American football night game.
Events.html: The Philadelphia Football Athletics defeated the Kanaweola Athletic Club of Elmira, New York, 39–0, in the first ever professional American football night game.

Events.text: Albert Einstein's paper that leads to the mass–energy equivalence formula, E = mc², is published in the journal Annalen der Physik.
Events.html: Albert Einstein's paper that leads to the mass–energy equivalence formula, E = mc², is published in the journal Annalen der Physik.

Events.text: Sailors on board Brazil's warships including the Minas Geraes, São Paulo, and Bahia, violently rebel in what is now known as the Revolta da Chibata (Revolt of the Lash).
Events.html: Sailors on board Brazil's warships including the Minas Geraes, São Paulo, and Bahia, violently rebel in what is now known as the Revolta da Chibata (Revolt of the Lash).

Events.text: Mines from SM U-73 sink the HMHS Britannic, the largest ship lost in the First World War.
Events.html: Mines from SM U-73 sink the HMHS Britannic, the largest ship lost in the First World War.

Events.text: The Flag of Estonia, previously used by pro-independence activists, is formally adopted as the national flag of the Republic of Estonia.
Events.html: The Flag of Estonia, previously used by pro-independence activists, is formally adopted as the national flag of the Republic of Estonia.

Events.text: A pogrom takes place in Lwów (now Lviv); over three days, at least 50 Jews and 270 Ukrainian Christians are killed by Poles.
Events.html: 1918 – A pogrom takes place in Lwów (now Lviv); over three days, at least 50 Jews and 270 Ukrainian Christians are killed by Poles.

Events.text: Irish War of Independence: In Dublin, 31 people are killed in what became known as "Bloody Sunday".
Events.html: Irish War of Independence: In Dublin, 31 people are killed in what became known as "Bloody Sunday".

Events.text: Rebecca Latimer Felton of Georgia takes the oath of office, becoming the first female United States Senator.
Events.html: Rebecca Latimer Felton of Georgia takes the oath of office, becoming the first female United States Senator.

Events.text: Columbine Mine massacre: Striking coal miners are allegedly attacked with machine guns by a detachment of state police dressed in civilian clothes.
Events.html: Columbine Mine massacre: Striking coal miners are allegedly attacked with machine guns by a detachment of state police dressed in civilian clothes.

Events.text: The completion of the Alaska Highway (also known as the Alcan Highway) is celebrated (however, the highway is not usable by general vehicles until 1943).
Events.html: The completion of the Alaska Highway (also known as the Alcan Highway) is celebrated (however, the highway is not usable by general vehicles until 1943).

Events.text: The United Auto Workers strike 92 General Motors plants in 50 cities to back up worker demands for a 30-percent raise.
Events.html: The United Auto Workers strike 92 General Motors plants in 50 cities to back up worker demands for a 30-percent raise.

Events.text: Two Canadian National Railway trains collide in northeastern British Columbia in the Canoe River train crash; the death toll is 21, with 17 of them Canadian troops bound for Korea.
Events.html: Two Canadian National Railway trains collide in northeastern British Columbia in the Canoe River train crash; the death toll is 21, with 17 of them Canadian troops bound for Korea.

Events.text: The Natural History Museum, London announces that the "Piltdown Man" skull, initially believed to be one of the most important fossilized hominid skulls ever found, is a hoax.
Events.html: The Natural History Museum, London announces that the "Piltdown Man" skull, initially believed to be one of the most important fossilized hominid skulls ever found, is a hoax.

Events.text: American disc jockey Alan Freed, who had popularized the term "rock and roll" and music of that style, is fired from WABC-AM radio over allegations he had participated in the payola scandal.
Events.html: American disc jockey Alan Freed, who had popularized the term "rock and roll" and music of that style, is fired from WABC-AM radio over allegations he had participated in the payola scandal.

Events.text: The "La Ronde" opens in Honolulu, first revolving restaurant in the United States.
Events.html: The "La Ronde" opens in Honolulu, first revolving restaurant in the United States.

Events.text: The Chinese People's Liberation Army declares a unilateral ceasefire in the Sino-Indian War.
Events.html: The Chinese People's Liberation Army declares a unilateral ceasefire in the Sino-Indian War.

Events.text: The Verrazano-Narrows Bridge opens to traffic. At the time it is the world's longest bridge span.
Events.html: The Verrazano-Narrows Bridge opens to traffic. At the time it is the world's longest bridge span.

Events.text: Second Vatican Council: The third session of the Roman Catholic Church's ecumenical council closes.
Events.html: 1964 – Second Vatican Council: The third session of the Roman Catholic Church's ecumenical council closes.

Events.text: Vietnam War: American General William Westmoreland tells news reporters: "I am absolutely certain that whereas in 1965 the enemy was winning, today he is certainly losing."
Events.html: Vietnam War: American General William Westmoreland tells news reporters: "I am absolutely certain that whereas in 1965 the enemy was winning, today he is certainly losing."

Events.text: U.S. President Richard Nixon and Japanese Premier Eisaku Satō agree on the return of Okinawa to Japanese control in 1972. The U.S. retains rights to bases on the island, but these are to be nuclear-free.
Events.html: U.S. President Richard Nixon and Japanese Premier Eisaku Satō agree on the return of Okinawa to Japanese control in 1972. The U.S. retains rights to bases on the island, but these are to be nuclear-free.

Events.text: The first permanent ARPANET link is established between UCLA and SRI.
Events.html: 1969 – The first permanent ARPANET link is established between UCLA and SRI.

Events.text: Vietnam War: Operation Ivory Coast: A joint United States Air Force and Army team raids the Sơn Tây prisoner-of-war camp in an attempt to free American prisoners of war thought to be held there.
Events.html: Vietnam War: Operation Ivory Coast: A joint United States Air Force and Army team raids the Sơn Tây prisoner-of-war camp in an attempt to free American prisoners of war thought to be held there.

Events.text: Indian troops, partly aided by Mukti Bahini (Bengali guerrillas), defeat the Pakistan army in the Battle of Garibpur.
Events.html: Indian troops, partly aided by Mukti Bahini (Bengali guerrillas), defeat the Pakistan army in the Battle of Garibpur.

Events.text: Voters in South Korea overwhelmingly approve a new constitution, giving legitimacy to Park Chung-hee and the Fourth Republic.
Events.html: Voters in South Korea overwhelmingly approve a new constitution, giving legitimacy to Park Chung-hee and the Fourth Republic.

Events.text: The Birmingham pub bombings kill 21 people. The Birmingham Six are sentenced to life in prison for the crime but subsequently acquitted.
Events.html: The Birmingham pub bombings kill 21 people. The Birmingham Six are sentenced to life in prison for the crime but subsequently acquitted.

Events.text: Minister of Internal Affairs Allan Highet announces that the national anthems of New Zealand shall be the traditional anthem "God Save the Queen" and "God Defend New Zealand".
Events.html: Minister of Internal Affairs Allan Highet announces that the national anthems of New Zealand shall be the traditional anthem "God Save the Queen" and "God Defend New Zealand".

Events.text: The United States Embassy in Islamabad, Pakistan, is attacked by a mob and set on fire, killing four.
Events.html: The United States Embassy in Islamabad, Pakistan, is attacked by a mob and set on fire, killing four.

Events.text: A deadly fire breaks out at the MGM Grand Hotel in Paradise, Nevada (now Bally's Las Vegas). Eighty-seven people are killed and more than 650 are injured in the worst disaster in Nevada history.
Events.html: A deadly fire breaks out at the MGM Grand Hotel in Paradise, Nevada (now Bally's Las Vegas). Eighty-seven people are killed and more than 650 are injured in the worst disaster in Nevada history.

Events.text: United States Navy intelligence analyst Jonathan Pollard is arrested for spying after being caught giving Israel classified information on Arab nations. He is subsequently sentenced to life in prison.
Events.html: United States Navy intelligence analyst Jonathan Pollard is arrested for spying after being caught giving Israel classified information on Arab nations. He is subsequently sentenced to life in prison.

Events.text: National Security Council member Oliver North and his secretary start to shred documents allegedly implicating them in the Iran–Contra affair.
Events.html: National Security Council member Oliver North and his secretary start to shred documents allegedly implicating them in the Iran–Contra affair.

Events.text: A major tornado strikes the Houston, Texas area during the afternoon. Over the next two days the largest tornado outbreak ever to occur in the US during November spawns over 100 tornadoes.
Events.html: A major tornado strikes the Houston, Texas area during the afternoon. Over the next two days the largest tornado outbreak ever to occur in the US during November spawns over 100 tornadoes.

Events.text: The Dayton Agreement is initialed at the Wright-Patterson Air Force Base, near Dayton, Ohio, ending three and a half years of war in Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Events.html: The Dayton Agreement is initialed at the Wright-Patterson Air Force Base, near Dayton, Ohio, ending three and a half years of war in Bosnia and Herzegovina.

Events.text: Humberto Vidal explosion: Thirty-three people die when a Humberto Vidal shoe shop explodes.
Events.html: Humberto Vidal explosion: Thirty-three people die when a Humberto Vidal shoe shop explodes.

Events.text: NATO invites Bulgaria, Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, Romania, Slovakia and Slovenia to become members.
Events.html: NATO invites Bulgaria, Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, Romania, Slovakia and Slovenia to become members.

Events.text: The second round of the Ukrainian presidential election is held, giving rise to massive protests and controversy over the election's integrity.
Events.html: The second round of the Ukrainian presidential election is held, giving rise to massive protests and controversy over the election's integrity.

Events.text: Dominica is hit by the most destructive earthquake in its history. The northern half of the island sustains the most damage, especially the town of Portsmouth. In neighboring Guadeloupe, one person is killed.
Events.html: 2004 – Dominica is hit by the most destructive earthquake in its history. The northern half of the island sustains the most damage, especially the town of Portsmouth. In neighboring Guadeloupe, one person is killed.

Events.text: The Paris Club agrees to write off 80% (up to $100 billion) of Iraq's external debt.
Events.html: 2004 – The Paris Club agrees to write off 80% (up to $100 billion) of Iraq's external debt.

Events.text: Anti-Syrian Lebanese politician and government minister Pierre Gemayel is assassinated in suburban Beirut.
Events.html: Anti-Syrian Lebanese politician and government minister Pierre Gemayel is assassinated in suburban Beirut.

Events.text: A mine explosion in Heilongjiang, China kills 108.
Events.html: A mine explosion in Heilongjiang, China kills 108.

Events.text: At least 28 are wounded after a bomb is thrown onto a bus in Tel Aviv.
Events.html: At least 28 are wounded after a bomb is thrown onto a bus in Tel Aviv.

Events.text: The first of to become massive protests start in Ukraine after President Viktor Yanukovych suspended signing the Ukraine–European Union Association Agreement.
Events.html: The first of to become massive protests start in Ukraine after President Viktor Yanukovych suspended signing the Ukraine–European Union Association Agreement.

Events.text: A stampede in Kwekwe, Zimbabwe caused by the police firing tear gas kills at least eleven people and injures 40 others.
Events.html: A stampede in Kwekwe, Zimbabwe caused by the police firing tear gas kills at least eleven people and injures 40 others.

Events.text: The government of Belgium imposed a security lockdown on Brussels, including the closure of shops, schools, public transportation, due to potential terrorist attacks.
Events.html: The government of Belgium imposed a security lockdown on Brussels, including the closure of shops, schools, public transportation, due to potential terrorist attacks.

Births.html: John Bale, English bishop and historian (d. 1563)
